meanings.definition: To kick or strike with the foot.
meanings.sent1: He booted the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: She booted the door open when her hands were full.
meanings.sent3: The cat booted the toy mouse across the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm booted the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The player booted the ball with all his might.

meanings.definition: To start up a computer by loading an operating system or program.
meanings.sent1: Dad booted the computer to check his emails.
meanings.sent2: I always boot my laptop first thing in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The computer booted up just in time for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The system booted smoothly without any errors.
meanings.sent5: She booted the device and waited for it to load.

meanings.sent1: The booting hiker climbed the mountain with ease.
meanings.sent2: She felt confident in her booted attire.
meanings.sent3: The booted cowboy strutted into the saloon.
meanings.sent4: The booted soldier marched proudly in the parade.
meanings.sent5: He admired the booted dancers on stage.
